meanings.definition: Excessively proper or punctilious in one's behavior or manners.
meanings.sent1: She always wore a priggish expression, never letting loose.
meanings.sent2: The priggish lady insisted on following every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent3: The priggish penguin refused to slide down the icy hill with the others.
meanings.sent4: His priggish attitude was like a shiny, but fragile, glass sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The priggish butler straightened every crease in the tablecloth with precision.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an exaggerated sense of one's own importance or correctness.
meanings.sent1: The priggish professor always thought his opinion was the only correct one.
meanings.sent2: She had a priggish way of speaking, as if she knew everything better than anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The priggish cat walked around with its tail held high, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: His priggish behavior made him seem like a king in his own little world.
meanings.sent5: The priggish mayor acted as if every decision he made was of utmost importance.
